data.title: The Forsyte Saga
data.meta_description: Galsworthy - Free download as Word Doc (.doc), PDF File (.pdf), Text File (.txt) or read online for free. John Galsworthy was an English novelist and playwright who was awarded the Nobel Prize for Literature in 1932. He was born in 1867 in Surrey, England to a wealthy family with roots tracing back to the 16th century. Galsworthy was educated at Harrow and Oxford and initially practiced law, but found it uncongenial and took up writing instead. He is best known for his novel sequence The Forsyte Saga, which chronicles the lives of three generations of an upper-middle class English family and explores themes of wealth, property, and social change. Galsworthy also had success as a dramatist with plays that examined controversial social issues. He received widespread acclaim during his lifetime but saw his reputation
